items.longDescription:
T-shirt with a large print of Ai's back figure in the spotlight on stage on the back along with Ai's signature. On the front, the design of Ai's cheering goods is designed as a single point on the chest.

【OSHI NO KO】

【OSHI NO KO】 is a manga series currently serialized in “WEEKLY YOUNG JUMP” and the first anime season was released in 2023. This is the first collaboration with 【OSHI NO KO】, as it prepares to air its second season. This is an original collection available only for UT, incorporating the cute and dark world of the popular characters into the designs.

©A x Y/S, OP

items.longDescription:
UT ARCHIVE Andy Warhol / Keith Haring / Jean-Michel Basquiat

“UT Archive” is a project that revives carefully selected T-shirts which have been sold in the past. From the UT collection that has been on sale for about 20 years, popular patterns by Andy Warhol, Basquiat, and Keith Haring will be re-released.

Andy Warhol
As the preeminent American artist of the 20th Century, Andy Warhol challenged the world to see art differently. This product is produced under a license from The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc., a New York not-for-profit corporation which promotes the visual arts.

Keith Haring
A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,”with abstract marks and patterning.

Jean-Michel Basquiat
An icon of New York in the 1980s, Jean-Michel Basquiat became renowned during his short career for works inspired by his early street art and a distinctive iconography often connected to art history. His paintings, drawings, and prints drew on a diverse range of sources, from African, Aztec, and Greek cultures to Americana in the form of jazz, baseball, and social and political events.

©/®/™ The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc.
© Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
© Estate of Jean-Michel Basquiat. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
items.name: NY POP ART Archive UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.washingInformation: Machine wash cold, Do not Dry Clean, Tumble dry low.

Ukiyo-e

We are proud to present a distinctive collection that brings the vibrant tones and bold lines of Ukiyo-e prints to everyday wear. Don’t miss this opportunity to sport iconic Ukiyo-e works from Hokusai, Hiroshige, and Kuniyoshi, three of Japan’s greatest Ukiyo-e masters.

items.longDescription:
This t-shirt features a scene in Yu Nagaba's unique style from the movie "Big Hero 6'', where the main character Hiro, who has lost his beloved brother Tadashi and closes his heart, meets Baymax. We also recommend matching outfits with your family and friends, along with the Baymax designs from WOMENS and KIDS UT.

MAGIC FOR ALL with Yu Nagaba

A collection specially drawn by artist Yu Nagaba featuring Disney, Pixar, Marvel and STAR WARS works, with scenes selected based on the themes of love and bonds. The collection is strongly influenced by Yu Nagaba's own experiences, such as the STAR WARS movies he watched as a child and the Pixar films he watched with his children after becoming a father.

Yu Nagaba
Artist, born 1976 in Tokyo. Known for his artworks that are drawn only with simple and few lines. In addition to exhibiting his works in Japan as well as internationally, he has also participated in numerous art fairs as an artist, while also collaborating with brands in advertising and apparel.

©Disney

items.longDescription:
Keith Haring X Coca-Cola®

The Keith Haring × Coca-Cola story brings together two American pop culture icons. During his lifetime, Keith Haring created artwork featuring the iconic Coca-Cola logo. He loved Coca-Cola, what it represented, and would even personalize Coca-Cola cans in his signature art style when his friends visited his studio. Enjoy the special designs available only at UNIQLO.

Keith Haring
A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,” with abstract marks and patterning.

© Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
©The Coca-Cola Company. All Rights Reserved.

Premium fabric with a fine texture on both sides for a smooth feel.
The special looped lining prevents pilling and sagging.

features.text: Water-repellent finish. *The fabric is coated with a water-repellent agent so the effect lasts longer. The finish is not permanent.

items.longDescription:
- Warm, lightweight, high-quality down with a fill power of 750+.
- Water-repellent finish. *The fabric is coated with a water-repellent agent so the effect lasts longer. The finish is not permanent.
- Convenient pocketable design. The storage pouch fastens with a buckle and can be attached or removed with a single touch.
- Anti-static lining.
- Regular fit makes a great outer or middle layer.
*Color name is ”02 LIGHT GRAY”, but an actual color way is between light gray and light blue.
